REVIEW

Namecheap Website Builder Review

After 16 hours testing Namecheap website builder, I found a basic builder from a popular domain registrar. Good if you already buy domains from Namecheap, but severely limited compared to modern AI builders.

Updated: January 2025 - 16 hours of hands-on testing
| Score: 7.0/10 | How I Test

Quick Verdict

Namecheap website builder is only worth it if you already use their domains. Otherwise, there are much better options.

The tradeoffs: Dated templates, minimal AI features, and limited customization. You're paying for convenience.

Choose Namecheap if you want simple integration with your existing domains. Choose Hostinger, Wix, or Framer for better features and value.

What I Tested

  • ✓Website builder interface
  • ✓AI text generation
  • ✓Template library
  • ✓Domain integration
  • ✓E-commerce features
  • ✓PageSpeed testing

Testing Timeline

Day 1
Started with Namecheap builder. Very basic interface, limited templates.
Day 2
Explored AI features. Minimal AI - just basic text generation.
Day 3
Tested templates. Old-fashioned designs, not modern.
Day 4
Checked integration. Works well with Namecheap domains.
Day 5
Tested support. Good support, as expected from Namecheap.
Day 6
Evaluated pricing. Affordable but not great value.
Day 7
Final assessment: Only for existing Namecheap customers who want simplicity.

Pros

  • ✓Great for Namecheap domain customers
  • ✓Easy domain integration
  • ✓Affordable pricing
  • ✓Good customer support
  • ✓Free SSL certificate
  • ✓Simple to use
  • ✓No coding required

Cons

  • ✗Very basic AI features
  • ✗Dated template designs
  • ✗Limited customization
  • ✗No code export
  • ✗Below-average PageSpeed
  • ✗Few templates available
  • ✗Basic e-commerce

The Domain Registrar Advantage

Namecheap is one of the most popular domain registrars. Their website builder is designed for customers who want everything in one place.

  • Easy domain connection - Your domains are already there
  • Unified management - One dashboard for domains + hosting
  • Free SSL - Security certificates included
  • Competitive pricing - Affordable domain prices

However, if you're not already a Namecheap customer, there's no compelling reason to choose their builder over Hostinger ($2.99/mo), Wix ($16/mo), or Framer ($15/mo).

The "Everything in One Place" Illusion

When convenience doesn't equal quality

Namecheap sells you on convenience: "Your domains are here, your hosting is here, your website builder is here—one dashboard, everything managed."

Sounds great. But here's what they don't tell you:

Your domains being "in one place" doesn't actually matter. Domain management takes 5 minutes per year regardless of where they are.

The reality: You're going to spend hours in your website builder. You're barely going to touch your domain settings.

So why prioritize domain convenience over builder quality?

I tested Namecheap's builder for 16 hours. It works. It's functional. But it feels like 2015 technology in 2025.

For the same price (or less), you could use Hostinger. Better templates. Better AI. Better editor. Just... better everything.

Who actually needs Namecheap's builder?

• People who already have 50+ domains with Namecheap and don't want to migrate
• Anyone who values brand familiarity over features

Who should avoid it? Everyone else. Use a dedicated AI builder, buy domains separately. The "hassle" of managing domains separately is nonexistent.

I rated Namecheap 7.0/10. For "everything in one place" convenience, it's a 7/10. For actual quality and features, it's a 5/10.

Try Namecheap (Direct)
